definition: On learning, classic book by Confucian philosopher Xun Zi 荀子 (c. 310-237 BC)
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
to strengthen moral ties between people/to have sexual intercourse (of a married couple)
Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
The School Sayings of Confucius (abbr. for 孔子家語|孔子家语[Kong3 zi3 Jia1 yu3])
wind vane/anemometer/weathercock/fig. person who switches allegiance readily/turncoat
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
Yang Zhu (c. 440-360 BC), Chinese philosopher advocating ethical egoism
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
